99

What happens if your patient is a minor, child, or has limited English ability?  

 

Click each button below to learn more.

Asking Language Preference:

Minor or Child

What happens when your patient is a minor or child? The Joint Commission suggests asking the parent(s) or guardian(s),

 

"In what language do you prefer to discuss the child’s health care?"

 

Then note their choice.

Asking Language Preference:

Limited English Ability

In some cases, you may need to arrange for language services to help identify the patient’s preferred language.

 

For example, you may not be able to communicate with a patient who is deaf, hard of hearing, or has limited English ability.  If you do not understand your health care organization’s procedures for assisting patients with limited English ability, ask your manager for assistance.
